meanings.definition: To shine brighter or more brightly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun seemed to outglitter all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her dress outglittered all the others at the party.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly tried to outglitter the streetlights but failed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could outglitter the brightest diamond.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outglittered the moon, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To surpass in glitter or sparkle.
meanings.sent1: The disco ball outglittered all the decorations in the room.
meanings.sent2: The sequins on her dress outglittered the stage lights.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy tried to outglitter the other fairies but ended up covered in glitter.
meanings.sent4: The ocean at sunset seemed to outglitter the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The jewels in the crown outglittered everything in the treasure chest.
